chapter_5.title: Pokémon Battles
chapter_5.description: This chapter details the rules of engagement for combat, from the first move to the final outcome, blending tactical depth with narrative freedom.

type_effectiveness.title: Pokémon Types & Effectiveness
type_effectiveness.description: Every Pokémon and every damaging move has one or two of the 18 known elemental Types. Understanding how these Types interact is crucial for victory.

mechanics.super_effective: Target is weak to the move's Type. Add 1 Extra Die to the Damage Dice Pool.
mechanics.not_very_effective: Target resists the move's Type. Remove 1 Die from the Damage Dice Pool.
mechanics.immunity: Target is immune to the move's Type. The move fails and deals no damage.
mechanics.dual_types: For Pokémon with two types, these effects stack (e.g., two weaknesses grants +2 dice; a weakness and a resistance cancel each other out).

flow_of_battle.title: The Flow of Battle
flow_of_battle.description: Combat is structured in a sequence of rounds and turns to keep the action clear and organized.

initiative.name: Initiative
initiative.description: At the start of battle, all participants roll. The character with the highest number of successes goes first.

round.name: Round
round.description: A round consists of every combatant taking one turn in initiative order.

turn.name: Turn & Multiple Actions
turn.description: On its turn, a character can perform up to five actions. The difficulty for each subsequent action increases.

action_resolution.title: Resolving an Attack
action_resolution.description: The sequence for determining the outcome of an attack.

sequence.name: Declare Move & Target
sequence.details: The active Trainer declares which move their Pokémon is using and who the target is.

sequence.name: Roll Accuracy
sequence.details: The attacker rolls their dice pool (Attribute + Skill).

sequence.name: Declare Reaction
sequence.details: The target may spend one of their actions to react by Evading (Dexterity + Evasion) or Clashing (Strength/Special + Clash).

sequence.name: Determine Hit
sequence.details: If the attacker's successes are greater than the defender's successes, the attack hits.

sequence.name: Roll Damage
sequence.details: The attacker assembles a Damage Dice Pool: Attribute (Strength or Special) + Move Power, modified by Type-Effectiveness.

sequence.name: Apply Damage
sequence.details: The number of successes on the damage roll is the initial damage. The target reduces this damage by their Vitality score.

pain_penalization.description: As a character takes damage, their performance suffers, removing successes from their rolls.

fainting.effect: The character is unable to take any more actions in the battle.

lethal_damage_optional_rule.description: For a more gritty campaign, if a fainted character continues to take damage equal to their maximum HP, they are at risk of death.

status_effects.title: Status Ailments & Conditions
status_effects.description: Lasting effects that can turn the tide of battle. A Pokémon can only have one primary Status Ailment at a time, but can have multiple volatile Conditions.

primary_ailments.name: Burned
primary_ailments.effect: Character has -2 to Attack stat and loses 1d10 HP after acting. Fire-types are immune.

primary_ailments.name: Frozen
primary_ailments.effect: Character is unable to act. Can attempt to break free with a Strength + Athletic roll. Ice-types are immune.

primary_ailments.name: Paralyzed
primary_ailments.effect: Character's Dexterity is reduced by 2. Has a chance to be unable to act on their turn. Electric-types are immune.

primary_ailments.name: Poisoned
primary_ailments.effect: Character loses 1d10 HP after acting. Poison- and Steel-types are immune.

primary_ailments.name: Badly Poisoned / Toxified
primary_ailments.effect: Character takes increasing damage each turn. Poison- and Steel-types are immune.

primary_ailments.name: Asleep
primary_ailments.effect: Character cannot act. Can attempt to wake up with an Insight roll.

volatile_conditions.name: Confused
volatile_conditions.effect: Character may hit themselves instead of performing an action.

volatile_conditions.name: Infatuated
volatile_conditions.effect: Character may be unable to attack the object of their affection.

volatile_conditions.name: Flinched
volatile_conditions.effect: Character loses their next action for the current round.

weather_conditions.title: Weather Conditions
weather_conditions.description: Certain moves or abilities can alter the weather on the battlefield, creating advantages and disadvantages for all combatants.

types.name: Sunny Weather
effects: Fire-type moves add +1 die to damage.
Water-type moves have total damage reduced by 1.

types.name: Rain Weather
effects: Water-type moves add +1 die to damage.
Fire-type moves have total damage reduced by 1.

types.name: Sandstorm Weather
effects: Damages non-Rock, Ground, or Steel-types each round.
Increases the Special Defense of Rock-types by 1.

types.name: Hail / Snowy Weather
effects: Increases the Defense of Ice-types by 1.
